title: Augusta County: Clinton Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, August 26, 1861
summary: Clinton Hatcher describes his pleasant accommodations in camp, the poor food supplied by the Confederacy, the rigors of dress parades, and his inability to keep the Sabbath. He replies to questions by Mary Sibert about receiving God's forgiveness for killing and about the treatment of southern civilians.
keywords: Camp Life, Church/Religious Activity, Military Authority, Military Strategy, State Government, Patriotism, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
